page.title: 01 School Weather Station
page.content: Christ Church School has a weather station to allow the children to study the weather data. In 1974, it arrived in kit form. There were hundreds of pieces and it had to be sent to a secondary school to be built. In 1982 a sundial was given to the school as a present by a stonemason who wanted to say thank you for his daughter's education. Mr. Burton is in charge of the weather study so Class 3 help him. These are some of the interesting facts that we found out:The highest wind speed recorded is 39 mph on the 3/3/82. The max. temperature is 34 Celsius, and the min. is -17 Celsius.The. max. rainfall recorded in 1 day is 68.8mm. The weather is taken at noon each day. Once we helped the police to find out how much rainfall there was as someone had had a crash.
